text:
Hi team

I am working on emails and coded my own drag and drop modules

I have recently had to replace all the image select fields with rich text snippets in order to add ?noresize param to stop the images resizing and becoming blurry

However the rich text snippet automatically puts the contents in a div.

Is there away to get the content of thr rich text snippet without using the default html div mark up it pulls in?

If you know the size maybe it would be better to do like this <@UFQ5JDYCF>? Image tags that have width and height attributes will get scaled on request I believe

<img src=“{{ module.background_image.src }}?noresize” alt=“{{ module.background_image.name }}” height=“220” width=“270" />

Thanks <@UG06JETGS> However this looks like your talking about landing pages / websites? I need this for emails so the macros differ if I’m not mistaken. I tried this with the correct macros and its seems if I dont include include_rich_text it doesnt format the image src correctly.
You are completely right, I read your message to quickly, my apologies!
I believe if you move the CSS to the head, the browser will not render until those CSS are downloaded. This may fix the reflow issue.
